content: and next 3 chs row 2 slip_stitch into next 2 stitches of pocket body turn skip 2 slip_stitch single_crochet blo into 3 single_crochet single_crochet in last st ch1 row 3 turn single_crochet blo down 4 single_crochet repeat row 2 and 3 across the top of the pocket ending on a row 3 repeat you may make your pocket larger or smaller by increasing or decreasing your beginning chain just make sure it s an odd number or by increasing or decreasing the amount of row 3 repeats of the pocket body repeat pocket body and pocket edging for second pocket i attached my pockets with a running stitch lined up with the cardigan edging but you can use whatever stitch you re comfortable with thank you i m so grateful you choose to spend your time and effort to create something i designed i hope you love your katy cardigan and i would love to see it please tag me on instagram @littlecarpcrochet and feel free to connect with me at any time i m happy to help with any questions also amazing testers a special thank you to all my wonderful testers i could not have done it without y all please check out their version and give them a follow on instagram as well cid 0 @charmaynehollis @knitislegit @runs with yarn @honybuny 3 @bishopcrochetco @carol_hladik_designs @crochet_will_save_the_world @theperfectionistcrochet @threefatescrochet @teatime_crochet @thinkingwithyarn @thecurlycrocheter @glasgow_craft @lyeonnes @whimsywoolctp @jmbranaum2021 @stephmakesshit do not attempt to distribute this pattern or any parts of this pattern as your own design
